comments:
I recall entering this bug a long time ago but I don't know where it is now and
that was an older version of Eclipse;  Probably 3.1m something.  In any event,
its back with a vengence!

I can no longer develop.  Somehow Eclipse refuses to let go of old plugins
launched and now when I try to launch a runtime workbench it crashes and
complains about not finding plugins A and plugins B, both of which are closed
projects that are not referenced in any way by the plugins in the workspace
currently.

I also tried to create a new launcher configuration but even then if somehow
finds the data!?!  I use linked output folders but I checked and they are not
linked to the same place (which is a mistake i made once before)

How does it know about plugins that are in CLOSED projects??
I am utterly baffled.  This is my error

This is so embarrasing.  It bug #83763 all over again.  Which is not a bug at
all :(  I knew this was so familiar.

This time though since my old flash drive is still good, this is a problem with
the flash drive itself.  It can't differentiate properly between stuff that
starts with the same letters then an '_' ocassionally.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 83763 ***

Let me hold this open for a week at least to entertain how this is even possible?

Directories

G:\WAD
G:\WAD_JETDS

Somehow when eclipse goes to launch, instead of loading from directory WAD which
has the project, it gets its data from WAD_JETDS which is a different project. 
I think there must be a directory that has the same name as what appears to the
left of the underscore for this error to occur.

That is the sum of this problem.  No it does not happen when I copy the same
files to the harddrive.  No I do not think the flash drive is wearing out.  This
does not affect my development, or display of the folders.  So I can open the
projects and edit them just fine with no problems saving or loading or listing
files.  It only occurs during PDE launch.  Which if you think about it makes
absolutely no sense at all.

Any tips on what source I should investigate to find the root cause of this
issue, or blame it on the JVM/OS?  Is the source I need to check part of the
Eclipse SDK, or do I need to download something?

Also, what is different about how the launching mechanism finds the project's
folders to add to the runtime workspace, versus how the PDE environment finds
the projects for editing.  I have been using and editing and compiling for about
2 weeks with no problem.  As soon as I try to launch it gets mixed up.  So I
want to isolate this difference.

Note: My projects all use linked output folders which are always on my harddrive.


To explain the log a bit more
folder               plugin
WAD                  com.rigidsoftware.wad
WAD_JETDS            cant remember
WAD2_DS_AccessDB     com.rigidsoftware.wad.jetds_core

The project names don't have '_' in them nor do the plugin ids.  its only the
folders the projects are in.  In reading bug #83763 again, I think this could
have something to do with the order the folders are returned in.  When I copy to
the harddrive the order is chanded.  Any tips would be helpful;  in the meantime
I'll dig deeper.
I gave up on this.  I don't use linked output folders anymore.  No longer investigating.  Another time...
